conclusion: Determine which container (D or E) the liquid will flow into after passing through baffles from points A, B, and C.
Liquid flows out from points A, B, and C.
The liquid from point A will flow downward.
It encounters a baffle that directs it to the left.
The liquid continues flowing leftward until it reaches the bottom of the system.
At the bottom, the liquid is directed towards container D.
The liquid from point B will flow downward.
It encounters a baffle that directs it to the right.
The liquid continues flowing rightward until it reaches the bottom of the system.
At the bottom, the liquid is directed towards container E.
The liquid from point C will flow downward.
It encounters a baffle that directs it to the right.
The liquid continues flowing rightward until it reaches the bottom of the system.
At the bottom, the liquid is directed towards container E.
The baffles play a crucial role in directing the flow of the liquid.
The liquid from point A is directed to the left and ends up in container D.
The liquids from points B and C are both directed to the right and end up in container E.
The liquid from point A will flow into container D.
The liquids from points B and C will flow into container E.
